Job Title: Manager, Client Success

Location: South Bend-Mishawaka Region

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
WHO WE ARE: 
AC3 was founded by practicing oncologists along with data and practice analytics experts to support the business side of medicine. Our mission is to modernize and digitize the delivery of healthcare revenue cycle management and improve countless lives along the way. 
We combine the power of big data technology and people to enable easier frontline decisions about complex problems. AC3 offers its employees an exciting, fast-paced, and challenging work environment. To learn more about AC3, visit us at www.ac3health.com. 
COMPANY MISSION: To simplify healthcare revenue cycle management and reduce the cost of care, empowering care givers to focus on what matters most – fighting cancer.  POSITION SUMMARY: The Manager, Client Success is responsible for ensuring AC3 retains and grows its client base through the delivery of insights and overall value. This includes hiring, training, and developing a team of client-centered experts, and developing systems, processes, and tools to deliver high levels of client engagement and retention in a cost-efficient manner. This position works closely with the Sales, Revenue Cycle Management, and Product Development teams and will help shape AC3’s service model with a focus on delivering value to clients and using technology, process standardization, and training to deliver financial efficiency in Client Success operations. 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Support in the development of the AC3 Service Model (systems, processes, training, and practices) that support client onboarding and overall delivery of value through analytics, insights, and deliverables. Lead development of training program and resource creation/compilation to create a team of Client Success revenue cycle experts who can deliver insights to clients. Develop and implement plans for the Client Success team, including role definition, measures of success, reporting/tracking, hiring, and development. Define standard client deliverables, reports, and alerts that bring the most value to clients (in collaboration with internal teams). Support in the creation of Client Success budget, develop business cases for client success investments, oversee expense management, and drive down costs of the organization. Work directly with key clients to ensure engagement, retention, and growth, and to keep a finger on the pulse of Client Success operations. Assist with client/prospect questions, requests, trainings, demos, and presentations.  POSITION REQUIREMENTS Qualifications: Strong leadership skills and the ability to build high-performing, client-centric teams. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. Superior problem-solving ability. Strong understanding of healthcare revenue cycle management and broader healthcare operations knowledge. Ability to build great relationships and clearly communicate with all teams involved (internal and external). Proven ability to work collaboratively to ensure adequate resources are brought to bear to meet client needs from throughout the organization. Superior project management, time management and organizational skills and the ability to quickly adapt to multiple priorities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.) and Web Conferencing. Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s degree in a related field is preferred. 3-5 years of client success or related experience, preferably in an area related to healthcare revenue cycle management or healthcare operations. Experience with data analytics, as well as development, management, and analysis of KPIs and other metrics. Experience leading and developing teams. Experience developing complex and cross-functional systems, processes, and workflows. Experience with customer/client management and managing the tension between customers’ wants and needs. Work Conditions: This is a remote position with the expectation of travel to meet the needs of the position. Work is completed in a general office environment, sedentary in nature but may require standing and walking for up to 10% of the time. The work environment is favorable with adequate lighting and temperature, and no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc.  Must be able to operate standard office equipment and keyboards.  Why Work at AC3? When you become an AC3 Team member, you can expect ongoing training, support, and a work culture like no other. We offer our Full-Time Team Members medical, dental and vision health and wellness benefits, along with employer paid life insurance, long and short-term disability policies. Because our team’s health and wellness are our priority, we start new hires off with an above average paid time out plan and offer a comprehensive wellness program, including onsite biometrics and ongoing mental and physical wellness support. We also provide all Team Members with access to company sponsored financial wellness counselors, employee assistance services and the opportunity to enroll in our company-matched, 401k plan. 
Come join our Winning Team!

Experience Level (if available): None
